title: Japan’s PM vows to stay on despite bruising election loss
byline: Japan’s ruling coalition has lost its majority in the country’s upper house, but Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has said he has no plans to quit.

title: Man wearing heavy metallic necklace dies after being sucked into MRI machine
byline: A 61-year-old man has died after he was sucked into a Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) machine at a medical centre while he was wearing a heavy metal necklace.

title: Asgiri Anunayake Thera passes away
byline: The Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Anamaduwa Dammadassi Thera, passed away at the age of 67.

title: ECB awarded hosting rights for the next three WTC Finals
byline: During the ICC Annual Conference 2025, it was confirmed that England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) have been awarded hosting rights for the next three World Test Championship Finals.

title: 21 injured in Galigamuwa bus accident
byline: At least 21 passengers were injured following a collision between two buses in Galigamuwa, within the Kegalla police area, early this morning, police said.

title: Ellen DeGeneres: I moved to the UK because of Trump
byline: US TV star Ellen DeGeneres has made her first public appearance since moving to the UK, saying she decided to settle in England the day after Donald Trump was re-elected US president.

title: Sri Lanka to consider oil purchases from U.S. to reduce trade gap
byline: Sri Lanka remains ready to consider oil purchases from the United States (U.S.) to reduce the trade gap as a qualification for further reduction of reciprocal tariffs, a Minister who is familiar with trade negotiations said.

title: Over 2,100 complaints filed with Bribery Commission in 2025
byline: Corruption within Sri Lanka’s state sector remains a growing concern, prompting increased action by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: 3 dead, 150 rescued after ferry catches fire in waters off Indonesia’s North Sulawesi province
byline: At least three people were killed and around 150 others rescued after a passenger ship caught fire in the waters off Indonesia’s North Sulawesi province on Sunday, officials and local media reported.

title: New education reforms will increase burden on students: Stalin
byline: The upcoming education reforms set to be launched in 2026 will further increase the burden on students, Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) General Secretary Joseph Stalin said.

title: Let the Whistle Blow Fair
byline: As the Dialog Schools Rugby League reaches its decisive stages, a controversial issue is quietly simmering beneath the surface — one that threatens the very integrity of the game.

title: Seven women hospitalised after inhaling fume at Kandy salon
byline: Seven women have been hospitalised after falling unconscious inside a beauty salon located on Peradeniya Road in Kandy this evening.

title: Acting IGP warns of rising non-communicable diseases in police force
byline: Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has raised serious concerns about the health of Sri Lanka’s police force personnel, revealing that only 30% of police officers are in good physical condition, while the remaining majority suffer from non-communicable diseases (NCDs) or have not undergone proper medical check-ups.

title: Cardinal did not specifically request to appoint Shani, Ravi Seneviratne in prominent posts
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith never specifically requested for the appointments of Shani Abeysekera as CID Director or Ravi Seneviratne to be appointed as Secretary to the Ministry of Public Security, Director of the National Catholic Mass Communications, Fr. Jude Krishantha said today.

title: Conspiracy to destroy SJB, Sajith: Mujibur Rahman
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Mujibur Rahman dismissed rumours of an internal move to replace Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa, while warning of a deliberate conspiracy to politically weaken both the party and its leader.

title: Attempted nightclub shooting foiled in Kollupitiya
byline: An attempted shooting targeting an underworld gang member at a nightclub in the Kollupitiya area was thwarted when security personnel at the venue intervened and attacked the assailants.

title: Tsunami alert after powerful quakes strike off coast of Russia
byline: The Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre has issued a warning for Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula after two quakes - the larger with a magnitude of 7.4 - struck in the sea nearby on Sunday (July 20, 2025).

title: At least 14 dead in South Korea floods and landslides
byline: At least 14 people have died in floods and landslides caused by days of torrential rain in South Korea, the country’s disaster management office has said.

title: Teacher trainers to be trained under new education reforms: Minister
byline: Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya announced that starting in August, steps will be taken to train teacher trainers as part of the broader effort to improve teacher education and professional development in Sri Lanka.

title: Elephant runs amok during Ruwanwella Esala perahera
byline: A tense situation was reported in Ruwanwella last night when an elephant participating in the Esala Perahera went on a rampage.

title: Iranian national nabbed at BIA for attempting to travel with forged British passport
byline: A 47-year-old Iranian national was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) last night while attempting to flee to Europe using a forged British passport.

title: CEB technical engineers and superintendents to launch protest on Tuesday
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Technical Engineers and Superintendents Association has announced plans to launch a protest on Tuesday, July 22.

title: Ukraine seeks new round of talks with Russia
byline: Ukraine has proposed a new round of peace talks with Russia, President Volodymyr Zelensky has said, in a move aimed at restarting negotiations that halted last month.

title: At least 27 killed after Vietnam tourist boat capsizes in Halong Bay
byline: At least 27 people died after a tourist boat capsized in stormy weather in Vietnam’s Halong Bay on Saturday (July 19), state media reported.

title: Saudi Arabia’s ‘Sleeping Prince’ Prince Al Waleed bin Khaled dies after 20 years in coma
byline: Prince Al Waleed bin Khaled bin Talal Al Saud, known as the “Sleeping Prince,” has died after spending more than two decades in a coma following a traumatic car accident.

title: Three killed including two infants in Narammala accident
byline: Three people, including two infant girls, died in a tragic accident on the Narammala-Giriulla road in the Narammala Police Division yesterday afternoon (19).
